explanation: The report is correct. The function only reads through the response pointer (inspects r->flags_auto, r->flags, r->first_header and traverses the header list) and does not modify the pointed-to MHD_Response object, so under MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 the parameter should be declared to point to a const-qualified type (e.g. const struct MHD_Response *response). The local alias 'struct MHD_Response *const r = response;' only makes the pointer itself const, it does not const-qualify the pointee, so it does not satisfy the intent of the rule. (Note: changing the parameter to const may require adjusting local declarations to const as well — e.g. const struct MHD_Response *const r and possibly const struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *hdr — and callers may need update if they relied on a non-const parameter.)
